sen.e: SAKANOUE no Haruko (year of birth unknown – 834) was a daughter of SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro.

sen.j: 桓武天皇の妃となり、葛井親王・春日内親王を生む。
sen.e: She became a wife of Emperor Kanmu and gave birth to Imperial Prince Kadoi and Imperial Princess Kasuga.

sen.j: 桓武天皇の崩御後、摂津国住吉郡平野庄（大阪市平野区）の領主で、兄弟である坂上広野を頼り平野庄に住む。
sen.e: After the demise of Emperor Kanmu, she moved to Hirano manor, Sumiyoshi County, Settsu Province (Hirano Ward, Osaka City) relying on her brother, SAKANOUE no Hirono who was the feudal lord of Hirano manor.

sen.j: 坂上氏の尼寺の長寶寺（長宝寺）を開き、同寺は坂上氏累代の尼寺となる。
sen.e: She opened Choho-ji Temple, a nunnery of the Sakanoue family, and it became a nunnery of the successive generations of the Sakanoue family.
